text: No worries @Fatima! I've just got back from New York for a wedding and I enjoyed 5 days off without any email or anything which was glorious :grin:

the new team would be a place where you can share advice you've received from your mentor with friends who you think will also appreciate it and you want to help motivate ... also you can compete with those friends for points and things that you'd get as part of your mentoring convos (sort of like Fantasy Football style!)
Do you think you would share advice with friends? Why / Why not? Interested to hear your thoughts!
Regarding your concerns about balancing studies vs work experience / careers, I completely know where you are coming from.
I can imagine your teachers are telling you to do everything all at once i.e. both studies & career stuff ...

You just have to be clever about it. Think: what is URGENT i.e. do I have an exam / coursework deadline coming up and how much time do I need to work on that? Do I have to have work experience by a certain date and if so, when would I need to start applying in order to give employers time to respond?

Of course, being overly focused on studies would get you the grades, but you won't have contacts or the mindset that you get when you have work experience & speak with employers. But the opposite is also true ... too much focus on work and you won't get the grades you need for university or good jobs...

I can't answer the question for you, but I can perhaps tell you about my experience to hopefully give you some ideas! When I was studying my A-Levels, I used to work in all the breaks during the school day in between lessons and do a few hours at night and then I had a weekend job (9am-6pm) both Sat & Sun, and I had friends and a boyfriend to juggle as well! I would also read a lot about investment banking (which was my preferred career at the time). It was a busy time of my life, but somehow I managed!
Do you have a weekend job atm?
and why do you think having work experience will prevent you from doing well in your studies? Is it a lack of time that you are worried about?

BTW I know you will figure it out! Like I said, it might be a VERY busy (perhaps the busiest!) time of your life, but it is a great test of character :muscle::sunglasses:. If you can get through A-Levels, I believe you can do anything!
